t: Proverbs 15
A*pn soft answer turns away wrath, but*ld a harsh word stirs up anger.
The*ln tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but*ld the mouths of fools pour out folly.
The*ln eyes of the Lord*s are in every place, keeping*ld watch on the evil and the good.
A*ln gentle tongue is a tree of life, but*ld perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
A*ln fool despises his father’s instruction, but*ld whoever heeds reproof is prudent.
In*ln the house of the righteous there is much treasure, but*ld trouble befalls the income of the wicked.
The*ln lips of the wise spread knowledge; not*ld so the hearts of fools.
The*ln sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,*s but*ld the prayer of the upright is acceptable to him.
The*ln way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,*s but*ld he loves him who pursues righteousness.
There*ln is severe discipline for him who forsakes the way; whoever*ld hates reproof will die.
Sheol*ln and Abaddon lie open before the Lord;*s how*ld much more the hearts of the children of man!
A*ln scoffer does not like to be reproved; he*ld will not go to the wise.
A*ln glad heart makes a cheerful face, but*ld by sorrow of heart the spirit is crushed.
The*ln heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge, but*ld the mouths of fools feed on folly.
All*ln the days of the afflicted are evil, but*ld the cheerful of heart has a continual feast.
Better*ln is a little with the fear of the Lord*s than*ld great treasure and trouble with it.
Better*ln is a dinner of herbs where love is than*ld a fattened ox and hatred with it.
A*ln hot-tempered man stirs up strife, but*ld he who is slow to anger quiets contention.
The*ln way of a sluggard is like a hedge of thorns, but*ld the path of the upright is a level highway.
A*ln wise son makes a glad father, but*ld a foolish man despises his mother.
Folly*ln is a joy to him who lacks sense, but*ld a man of understanding walks straight ahead.
Without*ln counsel plans fail, but*ld with many advisers they succeed.
To*ln make an apt answer is a joy to a man, and*ld a word in season, how good it is!
The*ln path of life leads upward for the prudent, that*ld he may turn away from Sheol beneath.
The*ln Lord*s tears down the house of the proud but*ld maintains the widow’s boundaries.
The*ln thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord,*s but*ld gracious words are pure.
Whoever*ln is greedy for unjust gain troubles his own household, but*ld he who hates bribes will live.
The*ln heart of the righteous ponders how to answer, but*ld the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
The*ln Lord*s is far from the wicked, but*ld he hears the prayer of the righteous.
The*ln light of the eyes rejoices the heart, and*ld good news refreshes the bones.
The*ln ear that listens to life-giving reproof will*ld dwell among the wise.
Whoever*ln ignores instruction despises himself, but*ld he who listens to reproof gains intelligence.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is instruction in wisdom, and*ld humility comes before honor.
